title.rendered: Minecraft: Story Mode – the first episode is available for free on PC, consoles and smartphones

content.rendered:
21.10.2016 at 15:45 by Rhonda Bachmann – The first episode of the Telltale adventure Minecraft: Story Mode is now available for free on PC, consoles and mobile devices. The adventure with a total of eight chapters has now been completed and will soon appear in a Complete Edition. The remaining episodes can also be purchased either individually or through various season passes.

As recently announced by Microsoft, Mojang and Telltale Games, the first episode of the adventure game Minecraft: Story Mode can now be downloaded for free for PS3, PS4, Xbox 360, Xbox One consoles and smartphones with iOS and Android operating systems. The PC also gets the first episode with the subtitle The Order of the Stone at no additional cost, but this must be obtained from the Microsoft Store under Windows 10. Steam and other gaming platforms are therefore eliminated this time.

The other chapters of the eight-episode game can either be purchased individually or through various season passes. Episodes 2 to 5 are available for 19.89 euros, plus episodes 6 to 8 for 9.89 euros or the complete package for 29.79 euros. Originally, the game was designed for only five chapters, but was extended by three more chapters. A Complete Edition will also be released on October 28th, which includes all published episodes.

The first chapter of Minecraft: Story Mode was released on October 13th, 2015 for PC, PS4, PS3, Xbox One, Xbox 360 as well as Wii U and mobile devices. In the adventure, players take on the role of Jesse, who along with his friends worships the “Order of the Stone” who once slew an ender dragon. The lead role is voiced by actor and comedian Patton Oswalt. Visit the Minecraft: Story Mode topic page for more information.
